headline: It’s ‘Salome.’ But With Puppets.
abstract: A new staging in Austria looks all the more unusual viewed side-by-side with the Vienna State Opera’s classic production.
lead_paragraph: VIENNA — The most infamous part of Richard Strauss’s 1905 opera “Salome” is the Dance of the Seven Veils, a striptease performed by a character meant to be just 16. It’s a deliberately provocative gesture that helped make “Salome” the most scandalous opera of its time.
